title: Gas prices jump 5% on Trump-Putin disappointment
subtitle: (Montel) European gas prices jumped 5% early on Wednesday following news that Russia would temporarily suspend attacks on energy infrastructure but failed to agree to an unconditional ceasefire.
body:
The benchmark front-month TTF gas contract was seen last up EUR 1.91 at EUR 42.67/MWh on Ice Endex. Earlier, it hit a four-session high of EUR 42.89/MWh.
Russian president Vladimir Putin late on Tuesday agreed to suspend attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure for a month during a call with his US counterpart Donald Trump, Montel reported.
“It seems the lack of a ceasefire was disappointing,” said a cross-commodities analyst with a UK investment firm.
“It was to be expected,” said a Ukraine-based energy trader.
An analyst with a German energy firm also said the market was reacting to news from the talks, although he had expected a more bearish response from Russia’s pledge to halt attacks on energy infrastructure. 
“It’s not exactly what I was expecting as a price reaction,” he said.
Adding further support to the market, an unplanned outage at the Asgard field will cut Norwegian gas flows by 5.1mcm/day until Thursday morning, according to TSO Gassco.
